author: he852100
body:
1. Simplify pipeline commands
```powershell
get-*|Start
      Wait    =wait-*
      Stop
      Debug
      Receive
      remove
      enable
      disable
      *
```

----
2. Improve match results,Only available commands are displayed

Expected
```powershell
PS /> get-job|r
Remove-Job                   Receive-Job
```
Results
```powershell
PS /> get-job|r
root                         repo-remove

Expected

get-job|
Debug-Job        Remove-Job       Stop-Job
Start-Job        Wait-Job
Receive-Job      Start-ThreadJob
select           Where-Object
*
```
Results
```powershell
get-job|
    
```

comments.author: vexx32
comments.body: I believe the request is for command tab completion to suggest commands that are closely related to the input coming over the pipe (i.e., are capable of taking pipeline input that matches the Output type of the function prior.)

comments.author: mklement0
comments.body:
Thanks, @vexx32 - that makes sense.

@he852100: Interesting suggestion, but can you flesh out the original post accordingly and give it a more discoverable title?

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: It seems it is more suitable for PSReadline.

comments.author: vexx32
comments.body: PSReadLine may offer tab completion, but as far as I know it doesn't generate its own completion results and just uses the tab completion results available from PowerShell itself?

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: PSReadline could do more smart and/or use an option to expose completion results. In the repo we could only enhance API if needed.

title: [Feature Request]Simplify commands, match improvements
